title.narrative: 11.2 HARMFUL PRACTICES TO CHILDREN

description.narrative: 11.2. Social acceptance of traditional practices harmful to children in targed location e.g. FGM, child marragies and GBV and sexual abuse, which contributes to Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 11. CP Exploitation, abuse and violence against children in families and communities, especially gender-based and traditional harmful practi ces, are reduced

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 11.2. Social acceptance of traditional practices harmful to children in targed location e.g. FGM, child marragies and GBV andsexual abuse
No of prominet scholars participated and become convined to agree the position of MORA on FGC
No. of religious leaders mobilized against FGM and taking public initiatives against FGM
No. of communities mobilized against FGM and participating in public declarations for FGM abandonment
No. of targeted community-based initiatives to prevent and respond to early marriage (taken by Child Protection Networks, Child Protection Advocates, Child Protection Committees)
Existence of a government policy banning FGM (Yes/No)
Existence of national initiatives against FGM led by health professionals (Yes/No)
No of houshold heads committed total FGC abandonment under W2W
